<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 404, 386, 421]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 715, 447]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 447, 320, 460]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 504, 490]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 489, 380, 504]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 255, 530]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 653, 545]]<|/det|>
If working is needed for any question it must be shown below that question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 545, 380, 559]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators should be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 905, 589]]<|/det|>
If the degree of accuracy is not specified in the question, and if the answer is not exact, give the answer to three significant figures. Give answers in degrees to one decimal place.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 445, 603]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 614, 604, 629]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 629, 759, 644]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 644, 415, 658]]<|/det|>
The total of the marks for this paper is 130.

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 72, 544, 88]]<|/det|>
Brad travelled from his home in New York to Chamonix.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 133, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 102, 705, 120]]<|/det|>
He left his home at 16 30 and travelled by taxi to the airport in New York.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 118, 660, 135]]<|/det|>
This journey took 55 minutes and had an average speed of \(18\mathrm{km / h}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 150, 133, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 702, 166]]<|/det|>
He then travelled by plane to Geneva, departing from New York at 22 15.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 866, 180]]<|/det|>
The flight path can be taken as an arc of a circle of radius \(6400\mathrm{km}\) with a sector angle of \(55.5^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 700, 196]]<|/det|>
The local time in Geneva is 6 hours ahead of the local time in New York.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 494, 212]]<|/det|>
Brad arrived in Geneva at 11 25 the next day.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 228, 133, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 227, 712, 244]]<|/det|>
To complete his journey, Brad travelled by bus from Geneva to Chamonix.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 243, 583, 259]]<|/det|>
This journey started at 13 00 and took 1 hour 36 minutes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 258, 400, 274]]<|/det|>
The average speed was \(65\mathrm{km / h}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 273, 665, 290]]<|/det|>
The local time in Chamonix is the same as the local time in Geneva.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 305, 798, 321]]<|/det|>
Find the overall average speed of Brad's journey from his home in New York to Chamonix.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 320, 520, 337]]<|/det|>
